00030 // If the client doesn't specify these:
00031 static const int DEFAULT_OBJECTS_PER_PAGE = 4;  
00032 static const int DEFAULT_MAX_PAGES = 3;
00033 
00034 class OAException
00035 {
00036   public:
00037       // Possible exception codes
00038     enum OA_EXCEPTION 
00039     {
00040       E_NO_MEMORY,      // out of physical memory (operator new fails)
00041       E_NO_PAGES,       // out of logical memory (max pages has been reached)
00042       E_BAD_BOUNDARY,   // block address is on a page, but not on any block-boundary
00043       E_MULTIPLE_FREE,  // block has already been freed
00044       E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK // block has been corrupted (pad bytes have been overwritten)
00045     };
00046 
00047     OAException(OA_EXCEPTION ErrCode, const std::string& Message) : error_code_(ErrCode), message_(Message) {};
00048 
00049     virtual ~OAException() {
00050     }
00051 
00052     OA_EXCEPTION code(void) const { 
00053       return error_code_; 
00054     }
00055 
00056     virtual const char *what(void) const {
00057       return message_.c_str();
00058     }
00059   private:  
00060     OA_EXCEPTION error_code_;
00061     std::string message_;
00062 };
00063 
00064 // ObjectAllocator configuration parameters
00065 struct OAConfig
00066 {
00067   static const size_t BASIC_HEADER_SIZE = sizeof(unsigned) + 1; // allocation number + flags
00068   static const size_t EXTERNAL_HEADER_SIZE = sizeof(void*);     // just a pointer
00069 
00070   enum HBLOCK_TYPE{hbNone, hbBasic, hbExtended, hbExternal};
00071   struct HeaderBlockInfo
00072   {
00073     HBLOCK_TYPE type_;
00074     size_t size_;
00075     size_t additional_;
00076     HeaderBlockInfo(HBLOCK_TYPE type = hbNone, unsigned additional = 0) : type_(type), size_(0), additional_(additional)
00077     {
00078       if (type_ == hbBasic)
00079         size_ = BASIC_HEADER_SIZE;
00080       else if (type_ == hbExtended) // alloc # + use counter + flag byte + user-defined
00081         size_ = sizeof(unsigned int) + sizeof(unsigned short) + sizeof(char) + additional_;
00082       else if (type_ == hbExternal)
00083         size_ = EXTERNAL_HEADER_SIZE;
00084     };
00085   };
00086 
00087   OAConfig(bool UseCPPMemManager = false,
00088            unsigned ObjectsPerPage = DEFAULT_OBJECTS_PER_PAGE, 
00089            unsigned MaxPages = DEFAULT_MAX_PAGES, 
00090            bool DebugOn = false, 
00091            unsigned PadBytes = 0,
00092            const HeaderBlockInfo &HBInfo = HeaderBlockInfo(),
00093            unsigned Alignment = 0) : UseCPPMemManager_(UseCPPMemManager),
00094                                      ObjectsPerPage_(ObjectsPerPage), 
00095                                      MaxPages_(MaxPages), 
00096                                      DebugOn_(DebugOn), 
00097                                      PadBytes_(PadBytes),
00098                                      HBlockInfo_(HBInfo),
00099                                      Alignment_(Alignment)
00100   {
00101     HBlockInfo_ = HBInfo;
00102     LeftAlignSize_ = 0;  
00103     InterAlignSize_ = 0;
00104   }
00105 
00106   bool UseCPPMemManager_;   // by-pass the functionality of the OA and use new/delete
00107   unsigned ObjectsPerPage_; // number of objects on each page
00108   unsigned MaxPages_;       // maximum number of pages the OA can allocate (0=unlimited)
00109   bool DebugOn_;            // enable/disable debugging code (signatures, checks, etc.)
00110   unsigned PadBytes_;          // size of the left/right padding for each block
00111   HeaderBlockInfo HBlockInfo_; // size of the header for each block (0=no headers)
00112   unsigned Alignment_;      // address alignment of each block
00113 
00114   unsigned LeftAlignSize_;  // number of alignment bytes required to align first block
00115   unsigned InterAlignSize_; // number of alignment bytes required between remaining blocks
00116 };
00117 
00118 // ObjectAllocator statistical info
00119 struct OAStats
00120 {
00121   OAStats(void) : ObjectSize_(0), PageSize_(0), FreeObjects_(0), ObjectsInUse_(0), PagesInUse_(0),
00122                   MostObjects_(0), Allocations_(0), Deallocations_(0) {};
00123 
00124   size_t ObjectSize_;      // size of each object
00125   size_t PageSize_;        // size of a page including all headers, padding, etc.
00126   unsigned FreeObjects_;   // number of objects on the free list
00127   unsigned ObjectsInUse_;  // number of objects in use by client
00128   unsigned PagesInUse_;    // number of pages allocated
00129   unsigned MostObjects_;   // most objects in use by client at one time
00130   unsigned Allocations_;   // total requests to allocate memory
00131   unsigned Deallocations_; // total requests to free memory
00132 };

00134 // This allows us to easily treat raw objects as nodes in a linked list
00135 struct GenericObject
00136 {
00137   GenericObject *Next;
00138 };

00140 struct MemBlockInfo
00141 {
00142   bool in_use;        // Is the block free or in use?
00143   char *label;        // A dynamically allocated NUL-terminated string
00144   unsigned alloc_num; // The allocation number (count) of this block
00145 };

00147 // This memory manager class 
00148 class ObjectAllocator
00149 {
00150   public:
00151       // Defined by the client (pointer to a block, size of block)
00152     typedef void (*DUMPCALLBACK)(const void *, size_t);
00153     typedef void (*VALIDATECALLBACK)(const void *, size_t);
00154 
00155       // Predefined values for memory signatures
00156     static const unsigned char UNALLOCATED_PATTERN = 0xAA;
00157     static const unsigned char ALLOCATED_PATTERN = 0xBB;
00158     static const unsigned char FREED_PATTERN = 0xCC;
00159     static const unsigned char PAD_PATTERN = 0xDD;
00160     static const unsigned char ALIGN_PATTERN = 0xEE;
00161 
00162       // Creates the ObjectManager per the specified values
00163       // Throws an exception if the construction fails. (Memory allocation problem)
00164     ObjectAllocator(size_t ObjectSize, const OAConfig& config) NOEXCEPT(false);
00165 
00166       // Destroys the ObjectManager (never throws)
00167     ~ObjectAllocator() NOEXCEPT(true);
00168 
00169       // Take an object from the free list and give it to the client (simulates new)
00170       // Throws an exception if the object can't be allocated. (Memory allocation problem)
00171     void *Allocate(const char *label = 0) NOEXCEPT(false);
00172 
00173       // Returns an object to the free list for the client (simulates delete)
00174       // Throws an exception if the the object can't be freed. (Invalid object)
00175     void Free(void *Object) NOEXCEPT(false);
00176 
00177       // Calls the callback fn for each block still in use
00178     unsigned DumpMemoryInUse(DUMPCALLBACK fn) const;
00179 
00180       // Calls the callback fn for each block that is potentially corrupted
00181     unsigned ValidatePages(VALIDATECALLBACK fn) const;
00182 
00183       // Frees all empty pages (extra credit)
00184     unsigned FreeEmptyPages(void);
00185 
00186       // Returns true if FreeEmptyPages and alignments are implemented
00187     static bool ImplementedExtraCredit(void);
00188 
00189       // Testing/Debugging/Statistic methods
00190     void SetDebugState(bool State);       // true=enable, false=disable
00191     const void *GetFreeList(void) const;  // returns a pointer to the internal free list
00192     const void *GetPageList(void) const;  // returns a pointer to the internal page list
00193     OAConfig GetConfig(void) const;       // returns the configuration parameters
00194     OAStats GetStats(void) const;         // returns the statistics for the allocator
00195 
00196   private:
00197     typedef unsigned char byte_t;
00198 
00199       // Make private to prevent copy construction and assignment
00200     ObjectAllocator(const ObjectAllocator &oa);
00201     ObjectAllocator &operator=(const ObjectAllocator &oa);
00202 
00203       // Other private fields and methods...
00204     void ExpandPages(void) NOEXCEPT(false);
00205     bool CheckIfFree(void* Object) const;
00206     byte_t* increment_head(byte_t* head) const;
00207     void push_front(byte_t* &head, byte_t* newhead);
00208     void setup_header(void);
00209     void update_header(bool inuse, byte_t* Object, const char* label = 0);
00210     bool validate_object(byte_t const* Object) const;
00211     void delete_memblock(void* Object);
00212     unsigned node_size; 
00213     unsigned offset;    
00214     OAConfig oaconfig;  // the config parameters
00215     OAStats oastats;    // the stats parameters
00216     byte_t* FreeList;   // the beginning of the list of objects
00217     byte_t* PageList;   // the beginning of the list of pages
00218 };
